intro: Mentha × dumetorum var. natalensis, commonly known as Natal mint, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its aromatic, serrated leaves and clusters of small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky outcrops. It belongs to the mint family (Lamiaceae) and is known for its strong, minty fragrance. This variety is often used in traditional medicine for its purported cooling and digestive properties.
